name: Brace for Impact
descr: Extending your hands in front of you, you erect a thin, malleable barrier around yourself to help absorb the impact of incoming weapon attacks.  This grants you resistance against the physical aspects of weapon damage (bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing) until the end of your next turn.

name: Caustic Needle
descr:
You form a needle of acidic material and thrust it towards a creature or an object that is not being worn or carried within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 acid damage and if it is a creature it gains the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} condition.

Each time you would inflict @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} on a creature that is already at the maximum stacks, deal an additional 1d6 piercing damage instead.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: Inflict an additional stack of bleeding on a hit.
  • 1 Mana: The acid damage is increased to 2d6.
  • 2 Mana: The acid damage is increased to 3d6.

name: Censorship
descr: Pick up to two words or one combination of words up to five words long and speak them.  One creature that you can see within range must make a Presence (Save) check.  On failure, the creature cannot speak, write, or mentally communicate the chosen words or phrase for the duration.

name: Disuse Atrophy
descr:
The target living creature is affected by one of the following effects:

  • The target has disadvantage on either Strength (Save) or Constitution (Save) checks for the duration.
  • If the creature has 0 hit points, the creature gains one level of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ERBR3AG01H4N1L91]{Exhaustion}.

The effects of this spell cannot be stacked. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

name: Elemental Cloak
descr:
Your weapon surrounds itself with an aura of the element of your choice from the following list: Fire, Cold, Lightning, or Force. You can only choose one per casting, and it cannot be changed during the spell’s duration.
    For the duration of the spell, the target weapon deals an extra 1d4 of the damage type chosen, on top of its normal damage.

name: Force of Will
descr:
Using a minor form of telekinesis, you force your will outward and find yourself able to manipulate objects for a short amount of time.
    Anything you can see within 30 feet of you can be affected by this spell, and you can manipulate any object as you would with your own hand. You can open a jar or unlocked door, pour a glass of tea, retrieve something from a bag that’s too far away, or put something back in it without having to get up.
    This ability can only affect things that you could physically grab and move with your own hands.
    This effect lasts until the duration runs out, or it is dismissed. You cannot use this ability to use a weapon to attack, activate magical items, and it has a carry limit of 5 pounds.

name: Illusory Object
descr:
Picturing something that you've seen or imagined, you wave your hand and use your magic to visualize it within the world itself.
You can do one of the following:

  • Create up to three simple illusions that fit within 1 square foot. So long as you can see the illusory object unobstructed, then you can re-form the image as a minor action, or move it up to a total of 30 feet per round, shared between each of your illusory objects, as a free action.
    • Simple illusions do not have intricate carvings, textures, or multiple parts. A pocket watch might be a simple illusion, but no gears could be showing and it might lack a chain or any intricate designs.
  • Create one complex illusion that fits within 5 square feet. So long as you can see the illusory object unobstructed, then you can re-form the image as an action, or move it up to a total of 15 feet per round as a minor action.


    These illusory objects cannot give off light, sound, smell, or any other sensory effect, and are revealed as illusions when physically interacted with since objects pass through them. If a creature examines an illusion, it can succeed in determining that it’s an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your Spell Save DC. Reduce the Spell Save DC by 3 for this roll if the illusory object is complex. Attempting to simulate living creatures causes it to appear obviously illusory without the need to make a check.

name: Jolt
descr:
A quick jolt of electricity leaps from your finger towards a visible target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, and if it hits, this spell deals 1d10 lightning damage.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The range is increased to 120 feet.
  • 1 Mana: The lightning damage is increased to 2d10.
  • 2 Mana: The lightning damage is increased to 3d10.

name: Luminescence
descr: Your form glows with light at the casting of this spell.  You shed bright light in a radius of 15 feet and dim light for an additional 15 feet.  This light can be colored to your liking.

name: Minor Wonder
descr:
With a spoken word, you invoke a minor, supernatural wonder. You create one of the following effects within range:

  • Your face or body glows with a faint light. You faintly glow in the dark and cast dim light 5ft from you while glowing in this way.
  • Your voice booms and becomes three times as loud for 1 minute.
  • Harmless tremors shake the ground within range for 1 minute.
  • You can cause one ration to feed up to 5 people for a day.
  • You can cause up to 1 liter of water to turn into 1 liter of cheap wine or vice versa.
  • You create an instantaneous sound from a point within range, such as a rumble of thunder, rustling trees, the caw of a raven, or ominous whispers. This cannot be used to mimic coherent voices or long-lasting, linear sounds, like music.
  • When used in a freshwater pond or river populated with fish, the first fish caught within the duration has 1gp in its mouth. This can only be done once per long rest.

name: Stability
descr:
A living creature you touch begins to feel a solidarity and control in their system. Choose two of the following effects to happen:

  • If the creature has 0 hit points, the creature becomes stabilized.
  • The creature cannot be unwillingly moved from its spot for the duration. This effect ends if the target chooses to move more than 5ft.
  • The creature is immune to being knocked @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone} for the duration.

The effects of this spell cannot be stacked. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs

name: Alleviate
descr:
Gently laying your hands upon a creature, one condition of your choice on the target is temporarily disabled for the duration. @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.FGVFFYGPAFQGZ5RP]{Grappled}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.1EK5V6KTYAWC6S69]{Restrained}, and @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.JCWGEKZSDQWLCE3O]{Suffocating} cannot be alleviated.
    Should the creature receive the condition again, you must make a concentration check at disadvantage.
    Should the removed condition be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9KB959MRZ0H4IT4C]{Unconscious}, the creature awakes and is able to act as normal, but has 0 hit points, still makes death throws at the beginning of its turn, and takes damage as death throw fails.

name: Arcane Arrows
descr:
Drawing your arms as if drawing a bow, three arrows of raw magic appear as if nocked in an unseen weapon. With a flick of the hand, you send these three magic arrows outward and towards your foes. These arrows hunt unerringly for their target and deal 1d4+1 chaos damage each.
    You have to be able to see the target for an arrow to hit them. You can direct these arrows to hit one or several targets, and they all strike simultaneously. However, a single arrow can only hit one target.

Charge: This spell can be Charged, increasing the spell’s damage. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 2 Mana: Casts an additional bolt
  • 4 Mana: Casts two additional bolts

name: Biting Wind
descr:
Throwing your hands out, you bring forth a sharp blast of cold wind outwards from yourself in a 15 foot diameter sphere centered on you.
    When you cast the spell, any creature within the sphere, except you, must succeed on a Dexterity (Save) check. A failed throw results in being knocked back 10 feet and taking 1d6 cold damage and 1d6 slashing damage. A successful save negates the push, and the creature takes half damage.
    On each of your turns until the spell ends or concentration is broken, you can use your action to cast the effects of this spell again at no extra cost.

name: Burst Into Flames
descr:
With a snap of the fingers, a small spark of energy flairs up and attempts to ignite a target that you can see. You make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage, and must make a Dexterity (Save) check.
    On a fail, the target is now on fire and must make a Dexterity (Save) check at the start of each of their turns to put it out. Every time they fail, the target takes 1d6 points of fire damage. A successful save avoids being set on fire.

Charge: This spell can be Charged, increasing the spell’s damage. Costs and increase are as follow:

  • 3 Mana: Initial damage increases by 1d6
  • 7 Mana: Initial damage increases by 2d6, and damage taken from being on fire increases by 1d6

name: Conjure Fundamental
Mat-desc: a pound of clay or other moldable material
descr:
Shaping the clay in your hands, you envision what you molded filling the space, conjuring a simplified shape of a similar design unto the world with a soft pop sound.  

You can create one of the following solid shapes for the duration.  This shape can be no smaller in height, width, or length, than 1 inch.  When you do so, choose a simple, opaque texture and pattern to appear on it.  This pattern can repeat, but can be no more complex than solid wood grain or brick, and the texture cannot affect the shape of the object more than a centimeter.  The weight of the shape is 1-20lbs, decided upon its conjuration.

  • Cube: 1-10sqft.
  • Plane: 1-5ft width, 1-20ft length, and 1 centimeter flat platform.
  • Sphere: 5-10ft diameter.
  • Cylinder: 1-15ft height pillar, 1-5ft diameter.
  • Pyramid: 1-10ft base and height.
  • Triangular Prism: 1-10ft length, 1-10ft width and height.
  • Octahedron: 1-10ft diameter from point to point.
  • Cone: 1-5ft height, 1-5ft diameter base.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the effects at the cost of extra Mana: 

  • 1 Mana: Conjure an additional shape.  
  • 2 Mana: Conjure two additional shapes.

name: Eleemosynary
descr:
Sprinkling holy water on another creature, you move one positive 1st level spell effect currently affecting you to your target, dispelling the effect from you. The effect picks up where it left off on the other creature’s next turn, ignoring the turn that this spell was cast.
    Charge: This spell can be Charged to move spells of 2nd level or higher by spending Mana equal to the cost of the spell that you are moving. This spell cannot move 8th or 9th level spell effects.

name: Ethereal Mail
descr:
Touching a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor, you wreath them in a protective set of ghostly mail. The target’s base AC is now:

13 + Dexterity modifier

This spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell with an action.

name: Fists of Stone
descr:
This spell hardens the fists of a single target touched. For as long as this spell is active, the target is treated as if they have proficiency in unarmed strikes, and the damage of their unarmed strikes increase.
    If their damage was a base of 1, it is now 1d4. If the damage for their unarmed strikes is already a die (such as 1d4, 1d8, etc) then that damage is one step larger. (Refer to the 'Steps in Damage Size Table' in "Chapter 6: How to Play")

name: Identify
Mat-desc: A crystalline disc worth at least 100 gold
descr:
Touching one object throughout the casting of this spell, you attempt to learn the magical secrets that it holds. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them. As well as whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You also learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell was used to create it.
    Should you touch a creature instead throughout this casting, you learn what spells, if any, that are currently affecting it.

name: Lash Out
descr: With a quick few words, you send dozens of tiny, invisible bolts of magic outwards.  Any creature caught in range from you, except for you, must succeed a Dexterity (Save) check.  On failure, the creature takes 3d6 points of chaos damage.  On success, they take half damage.

name: Menacing Visage
descr: When you cast this spell you must designate a single target within range that you can see.  That target makes a Wisdom (Save) check.  If it fails, the target has disadvantage on attacks against the caster for the next minute.

name: No Reproach
descr:
With a flick of your wrist and a magic word, you cast a ward on a creature or object. While in effect, an attack roll made against the warded target causes the attacker to first make a Wisdom (Save) check. On failure, the attacker must change the target of its attack or else the attack fails.
    If the warded target harms or attacks another creature, or casts a spell on an enemy creature, this spell ends.

name: Open Wound
descr: You reach your hand out and make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach.  On hit, the creature takes 3d10 necrotic damage as their skin and tendons open up where you touch.

name: Nocuous Bubble
descr:
Placing your hands together and drawing them apart, you form a bubble of toxic material which launches towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, dealing 2d8 poison damage on a hit.
    Hit or miss, the bubble bursts and disperses noxious gas. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution (Save) check or become @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9X088PM7H5U2S1HQ]{Sickened} until the end of your next turn.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The radius of the noxious gas increases to 10 feet.

name: Proclaim
descr:
Holding out your holy symbol, you proclaim the tenants or teachings of your faith and the symbol begins to shine with radiant light. All other creatures within a 20ft radius of you must make a Dexterity (Save) check, taking 1d12 radiant damage on a failure or half as much on a success. All Fiends make saves against this spell at disadvantage. You conclude your speech at the start of your next turn and can choose to repeat this damaging effect as a non-action, prompting a new save from each creature that is within 20ft of you.
    For the duration of the spell, your holy symbol sheds bright light for 20ft and dim light for an additional 20ft.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The duration of the bright light cast by this spell extends to 1 minute, or until you lower your holy symbol, whichever comes first. As an action during this duration, you can force one target within the light to make a Dexterity (Save) check, taking 1d10 radiant damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

name: Sacrament
Mat-desc: 25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes
descr:
You perform a special magical ritual related to your religion or beliefs. Throughout the duration, the object cannot move more than 10ft away from you or the spell fails. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following ceremonies to perform:

  • One flask-worth of water you touch turns into holy water. This purifies the liquid of diseases, added poisons, and all other trace additives. This process cannot purify any liquid that is not mostly water.
        If cast without powdered silver, the holy water becomes plain water after 24 hours.
  • You touch one willing or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9KB959MRZ0H4IT4C]{Unconscious} creature whose morality has been magically changed and make a DC 20 Wisdom (Theology) check. On success, you restore the creature’s original moral alignment, though the curse or cause's of other effects may remain.
        If cast without powdered silver, the moral restoration lasts for 1 hour.
  • You touch one corpse. The corpse cannot be raised for the next 7 days.
  • You touch one object. No creature can possess or take control of the object for the next 7 days. If the object is already possessed and is not not cursed or bound to the object by magic, the soul is expelled from the object as part of the process.
  • You touch two creatures willing to be bonded together in marriage. For the first 7 days, both targets replace their lowest attribute with the other person's matching attribute, if it is higher, while within 30ft of each other.
        This effect cannot be used on the same two creatures more than once.

name: Hypothermia
Mat-desc: a chime on a string and something to strike it with
descr:
You strike a shrill tone and focus it towards a creature you can see within range, sending a terrible chill through its body. The creature must succeed on a Constitution (Save) check or take 2d8 cold damage and its movement speed is reduced by 5 feet until the spell ends. On a success, the creature takes half and the spell ends. Creatures acclimatized to cold weather have advantage on the save.
    Until the spell ends, you can use your action once per turn to intensify the icy sensation, causing the creature to suffer 1d8 cold damage and reducing its speed by an additional 5 feet for the duration of the spell. The spell cannot reduce a creature’s speed below 10 feet.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: A flying creature slowed by this spell must make a Constitution (Save) check at the beginning of each of its turns or fall 10 feet.

name: Stone Shot
descr: With a quick contact with the closest surface made of, or containing stone, you give a harsh word and a sizable stone projectile fires off at a single selected target.  Make a ranged spell attack against a single target.  If this attack hits, it deals 2d10 bludgeoning damage.

name: Tame Beast
descr:
Once per rest, you can convince one beast that you see that you mean it no harm, causing it to be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} by you for the duration.  If its intelligence is 6 or higher, the target must make a Wisdom (Save) check to resist the effect.  

The charm ends early if you harm the creature, or otherwise encourage another creature to do so.  

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the effect of the spell at the cost of extra mana to cast the spell:

  • 2 Mana: This spell now requires Concentration.  While the beast is charmed by you, you can give simple commands to it as a minor action that it must follow on its turn.  If it is injured in the process of undertaking this action, the spell ends.  These commands are available to you:
    • "Come": The beast will move up to 30 feet toward you.
    • “Go”: The beast will move up to 30 feet toward a target of your choosing.
    • "Sit": The beast will fall @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}.
    • “Fetch”: The beast will move toward, pick up, and return to you with an item or object it can reasonably carry.
    • "Sic": Without moving, the beast will make one attack against a creature you specify if it has the means to do so.

name: Treat Wounds
descr:
A creature you touch regains 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier in hit points. This does not affect undead or constructs.
    Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the healing done with this spell. For every 2 extra Mana you spend, you can increase the healing by 1d8 up to your charge limit.

name: Tunnel Vision
descr:
When you cast this spell you pick a single creature within range that you can see. They must make a Wisdom (Save) check, and should they succeed, there is no effect.
    If the target fails, pick a second target. The second target is now the only creature that the target affected by this spell can take hostile action against, for the duration of the spell.
    The creature affected by Tunnel Vision is compelled to attack and take aggressive action towards the second target while they are under the spell’s effects. Should the second target die, the spell ends for the affected creature.
    A creature affected by this spell can repeat the (Save) check at the end of its turn if the spell persists.

name: Barrier
descr:
Tracing a circle toward a creature, you manifest a magical and translucent barrier around it that shimmers slightly in the light.  

For the duration, the target gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of its turn.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the effect of this spell.  Costs and effect are as follow: 

  • 2 Mana: Cast on an additional target
  • 5 Mana: Cast on two additional targets

name: Cloak
Mat-desc: an eyelash encased in gum arabic
descr:
Upon touching a creature, the target becomes @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.YE63H7VLOHW7NFHO]{Invisible} to others until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as well, as long as it is on the target’s person.
    If a creature affected by this spell should pick up an object and it is in their sole possession, or placed somewhere on their person, then that object becomes invisible. This lasts until the spell ends, or the object is no longer on their person or in their possession.
    Should the target attack or cast a spell before the duration is up, the spell ends.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the damage done with this spell. Costs and increase are as follow:

  • 4 Mana: Cast on an additional target
  • 8 Mana: Cast on two additional targets

name: Discombobulate
descr:
You bombard a creature's senses with a deafening and unexpected noise. One target within range must make a Constitution (Save) Check. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 force damage, is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened} until the end of your next turn, and is moved back by one slot in the initiative order. On a successful save, it takes half damage and suffers none of the other effects.
    If you target a Surprised creature, it makes the save check with disadvantage. This spell has no effect on creatures that are @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened} or are immune to the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened} condition.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 2 Mana: Move the creature back an additional space in initiative.
  • 2 Mana: The sonic damage is increased to 5d8.

name: Dragon’s Breath
descr:
Upon touching a willing creature, you imbue them with the ability to release magical energies from their mouth as a mighty dragon would; provided they have a mouth to begin with.
    You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison as the damage type for the breath, and until the spell ends, all damage dealt from this spell is that type. While the spell is active, the creature can use an action to exhale energy of the chosen type in a 15 foot cone. Anyone caught inside it must make a Dexterity (Save) check. If they fail, they take 3d6 points of damage from the chosen type. On a success, they take half damage.

The spell DC for Dragon’s Breath is the spell DC of the caster.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the damage done with this spell. Costs and increase are as follow:

  • 4 Mana: Increase damage by 1d6 of chosen type
  • 8 Mana: Increase damage by 2d6 by chosen type

name: Lesser Cure
descr: You touch a creature and cure it of either one disease or one condition.  The conditions this spell can cure are @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ADW4EH0NKRDCRCA4]{Blinded}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.OBTES08D2XC130IG]{Paralyzed}, or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9X088PM7H5U2S1HQ]{Sickened}.  Assume that any @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Disease} can be cured by Lesser Cure unless the disease states otherwise.

name: Paralyze Person
Mat-desc: a small, straight piece of iron
descr:
Designate one humanoid within range of your spell that you can see. That target must make a Wisdom (Save) check and succeed, or be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.OBTES08D2XC130IG]{Paralyzed} for the duration of this spell. The target gets a chance to make another Wisdom (Save) check at the end of each of their turns, and on a success, they break free and the spell ends.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, increasing the damage done with this spell. Costs and increase are as follow:

  • 4 Mana: Cast on an additional target
  • 8 Mana: Cast on two additional targets


Note: Additional targets must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

name: Repress Emotions
descr:
You emit a field of flat emotion nearby, repressing more extreme emotions in nearby creatures for a time. Each creature in a 20ft radius sphere from your target point who wants to resist this spell must make a Presence (Save) check. On failure, one of the following effects happen:

  • The condition effects are suppressed for a @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.UK95BQ45TGSD5Q3V]{Frightened}, or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.Y822OUCDEPAG0HS8]{Frenzied} creature for up to the duration.
  • The condition effects are suppressed for an @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.JHOXE7HCCBCD8MSK]{Insane} creature for up to the duration.
  • The target creature is indifferent about a creature that it is hostile toward. This ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its allies being harmed. The creature becomes hostile again after the spell ends.
  • The target creature is indifferent about a creature that it is in love with. This ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its allies being harmed. The creature resumes its adoration again after the spell ends.

    Charge: By spending 2 extra Mana, the duration of the spell can be increased to 1 hour.

name: See the Unseen
Mat-desc: A pinch of Talc and a small sprinkling of powdered silver
descr: For the duration of this spell you have the ability to see @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.YE63H7VLOHW7NFHO]{Invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane.  Ethereal creatures and objects still seem ghostly and translucent.

name: Stupefy
descr:
A target creature you can see begins to see stars flitter across their vision as their thoughts loosen.  The target must make an Intelligence (Save) check or become @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.1O2HM8TA4RSTVAVL]{Stupored} for the duration, repeating the check again at the end of each of their turns to attempt to snap out of it.  

A @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.1O2HM8TA4RSTVAVL]{Stupored} creature may also repeat the save check upon receiving bludgeoning or force damage.

name: Twister
descr:
You kick up a wind at a point you can see, creating a small, continuous 5ft diameter twister. 
Any creature that starts its turn within 5ft of the twister must make a Strength (Save) check or be lifted 10ft into the air and shoved 10ft away from the twister.  If the creature is inside the twister, they take this save at disadvantage and are thrown 20ft upward upon failure instead.  

In addition, the winds of the twister disrupt ranged attacks shot within 5ft of it, reducing the chance to hit by -2. 
You can move the twister up to 10ft each turn as a minor action.

name: Ultimatum
Mat-desc: an engraved stamp or signet ring
descr:
You compel a creature to follow a selection of orders, temporarily limiting its agency to two choices you pose to it. The creature must be able to hear you in order for the spell to take effect, however it need not understand the language you speak. Describe two different courses of action which each fit into a single sentence and that the creature could reasonably accomplish on its next turn. The creature must then succeed on a Wisdom (Save) Check or be forced to comply. On a failed save, it must spend its entire next turn carrying out its choice of one of the two commands you outlined to the best of its ability. It also cannot take desperate actions before the end of its next turn.
    The courses of action you specify must each be able to translate into one of the effect categories below, and the spell fails if they both dictate the same category of effect against the same target(s). For example, commanding a bandit to "Backstab your boss" and "Fire your crossbow at the Bandit King" would fail because both commands target the same creature with the same listed effect type.
    You cannot dictate for a creature to harm itself directly or subject itself to a hazard that is known to it (such as a fire or a visible cliff or pit). Once a creature completes its chosen command, or if the creature is no longer able to pursue one or both of the commands on its turn, it ends its turn and the spell ends.

  • Act: The creature must take a single Improvised Action you can describe, moving within reach of relevant objects or creatures as needed. For example: "Pull the leftmost lever." "Toss me the book on that desk." "Go through the door and lock it behind you."
  • Attack: The creature must move within range of a creature or object you choose and make a single weapon attack against it. For example: "Shoot the other archer." "Smash that barrel open."
    • You may specify which of its weapons to use, including natural weapons.
    • The creature is not obligated to use optional abilities that would modify or replace the attack.
  • Cantrip: The creature must move within range of a creature or object you choose and cast a cantrip targeting it. The cantrip must have a casting time of 1 action or less. For example: "Cast Jolt on your master."
    • If the creature does not know the cantrip you name, it instead casts one it does know.
  • Move: The creature must move towards or away from a creature, object, or location you can name or describe. For example: "Grovel at my feet." "Get down from there." "Follow me."
    • You can also specify whether the creature should be standing, prone, flying, or otherwise.
  • Speak: The creature must share what it knows or speak to a creature you choose. For example: "Tell us the password." "Tell your friends we mean no harm."
  • Stop: The creature must stand still and do nothing on its turn. For example: "Stop what you’re doing."

name: Verminize
descr:
Targeting a creature that you can see within range, you cast this spell in an attempt to transform the target into a harmless creature. The target must make a Presence (Save) check to resist the change.
    On failure, you decide if the target transforms into a Chicken, Golop, Pig, or Toad. The target assumes the form and game statistics of the chosen creature, and all attributes except Intelligence are replaced by the statistics of the chosen form.
    The target's hit points, however, remain the same, and any damage to the target is retained after reverting back.
    The creature is limited in the actions that it can perform by the nature of its new form: it can’t speak, cast spells, or take any action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form and they cannot activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
    At the end of each turn in this form, the target repeats the Presence (Save) check until they succeed, ending this spell.

name: Weight of the World
descr:
Designating one creature within the spell’s range that you can see, you gather the force of gravity and bring it crashing down on the target. The target must make a Dexterity (Save) check. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d6 force damage and its base speed is reduced to 0 feet. On a success, the creature only takes half damage.
    Should the target fail its save check, the spell continues and the caster must keep up concentration. While the spell is ongoing, the target retains a speed of 0 feet, however, it does not take damage again. The target gets a chance to make another Dexterity (Save) check at the end of each of their turns to break free.

name: Zone of Silence
descr: For the duration of the spell, no sound can be created or heard within a 20ft radius sphere centered on a point that you pick within range.  All creatures and objects entirely within the sphere are @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened}, immune to force damage, and all verbal components from creatures within range cannot be fulfilled.

name: Comforting Shouts
descr:
You cry out magically laced words of encouragement to those around you. Up to six creatures of your choice that can hear you within range regain hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier.
    This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Charge: For every 2 extra Mana spent, this spell restores an additional 1d4 hit points. You cannot cast this spell to cost more than 16 Mana.

name: Dispel Magic
descr:
Select a single creature, object, or magical effect that is in range with a point of the finger. Any spells of 3rd level or lower on the target end immediately. For spells on the target that are 4th level and above you must roll an skill check using your spellcasting ability. You must beat a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If you succeed, the spell ends.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged. Doing so causes this spell to have the ability to dispel spells of higher levels without having to roll.

  • 2 Mana: Any spell of 4th level or lower immediately ends
  • 4 Mana: Any spell of 5th level or lower immediately ends
  • 6 Mana: Any spell of 6th level or lower immediately ends
  • 8 Mana: Any spell of 7th level or lower immediately ends
  • 11 Mana: Any spell of 8th level or lower immediately ends
  • 21 Mana: Any spell of 9th level or lower immediately ends

name: Fireball
Mat-desc: a tiny cloth filled with sulfur and tar
descr:
Choose a space within range that you can see. Each creature within a 20 foot radius sphere centered on the space you chose must make a Dexterity (Save) check. On a failed save the creature takes 8d6 points of fire damage, or half damage on a successful save.
    This fire spreads around corners and ignities unattended and non-worn objects that are flammable.

Charge: This spell can be Charged to do extra damage.

  • 4 Mana: 2d6 extra fire damage
  • 8 Mana: 4d6 extra fire damage
  • 16 Mana: 6d6 extra fire damage

name: Geyser
descr:
Pick a single space within range that you can see. From that space sprouts a geyser of hot water that erupts abruptly from the ground. Any creature occupying that space must make a Dexterity (Save) check.
    On a failure, a creature of medium size or smaller is thrown 15 feet in a random direction, falls @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}, and takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage. On a success, the creature keeps their footing, takes half damage and is moved 5ft in a random direction.
    Creatures of large size or larger that fail their save check fall @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}.

name: Haste
descr: The world seems to slow around you as your mind and body speed up.  Your movement speed is doubled, you gain +2 AC up to your armor’s maximum Dexterity Modifier bonus, if it has one, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Save) checks.   When you use an action to make an attack action or cast a cantrip, you can make an additional attack or cast an additional cantrip.  Alternatively, you can take the Action to Minor Action, Grapple, Shove, Trip, Dash, or Disengage actions instead.

name: Instant Lodging
Mat-desc: a pinch of ash from a fireplace
descr:
Pick a spot of unoccupied space, on stable ground, of at least 10ft by 10ft in dimensions, within range. From that spot sprouts a 10ft cube log cabin, complete with windows, a single front door, and a smoking chimney.
    The interior of the cabin is furnished with seating, a half kitchen, a table, a fireplace, and bunk beds. These furnishings can be changed and shifted upon casting, but cannot be changed after it is cast. This cabin also has no running water. When changing the furnishings you can have the following items:

  • Up to 2 chairs for medium creatures
  • A 5ft by 10ft table
  • Up to 4 bunk beds for medium creatures
  • A half kitchen that takes up room equal to 5ft by 10ft, and must be set along a wall
  • A fireplace that takes up a 5ft by 5ft space, and must be along a wall

      •     Anything that was created by the spell inside the cabin, should it be removed from the cabin, vanishes instantly. Anything left inside that was not part of the cabin is ejected immediately upon it disappearing.
          It is sized for medium creatures, and cannot fit creatures of a larger size. The inside of the cabin is also larger than its exterior makes it look, having a floorspace of 20ft by 20ft and standing 10ft high, and allows up to 8 medium sized creatures inside.
          Only those that the caster designates can enter the cabin. The temperature on the inside is comfortably dry and warm regardless of outside temperatures. Spells cast inside the cabin, can’t extend outside of it. Spells cast outside of it, can’t extend into the cabin. That does not stop spells from dealing damage to the cabin, however.
          This cabin has an AC of 11 and 70 hit points. It also has vulnerability to fire, resistance to piercing, and immunity to poison and psychic.
          Should the cabin be reduced to 0 hit points, or be dispelled, it immediately disappears and throws the occupants outwards 10 feet in a random direction, and each creature thrown this way takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage.
          Should the spell end naturally and there are still creatures inside, they are shunted out into an unoccupied space next to where the cabin stood, unharmed.

name: Revivify
Mat-desc: diamonds worth 300gp, which the spell consumes
descr:
You touch a creature that has died within the last minute, diamonds in hand. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point, remaining @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}.
    This spell fails if the creature has died of old age, and it does not restore any missing body parts.

name: Rolling Thunder
descr:
You let out a loud cry that is magically amplified and ripples out in front of you. A cone of piercing noise reaches out in a 30 foot cone in the direction that you are facing, using you as the origin point. Any creature caught in it must make a Constitution (Save) check.
    On a failed (Save) check, they take 4d6 force damage and are @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened} for the next round. On a successful save, they take half damage.

name: Syzygy
Mat-desc: Two medallions, shaped like a sun and moon
descr:
You draw upon the awe of great celestial alignments of the past and the mathematical inevitability of their future recurrence. Waiting for the perfect moment when, from your vantage point, all of your targets have fallen into a line, you bring your medallions into alignment in front of your forehead and speak an invocation. A brilliant bolt of light shoots from the medallions and travels along an 80-foot line originating from you.
    Make a ranged spell attack against each creature in the line, starting with the one closest from you and moving further away. On a hit, the creature takes 5d6 radiant damage and all subsequent damage rolls made during this spell deal an additional 1d6 damage, stacking up to a maximum of 9d6 total. On a miss, all subsequent attacks made during this spell gain an additional +1 to hit, stacking up to a maximum of +3.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: Before making any of the attacks, deal half of the spell’s initial on-hit damage to yourself and then gain both an additional 1d6 to damage and +1 to hit for the spell’s subsequent attacks.
  • 2 Mana: Increase the length of the line to 120 feet.

name: Virulent Outbreak
descr:
A cloud of dangerous pathogens erupts in a 30-foot cone originating from you and clings to the creatures inside of it. Choose one of the following @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Diseases}:

  • Kobold Flu: An infected creature has a -2 penalty to attack rolls and skill checks.
  • Lovers’ Pox: An infected creature suffers 2d4 poison damage when it starts its turn within 5 feet of any other creatures.
  • Mana Fever: An infected creature must spend 1 extra mana to cast spells and charged versions of cantrips.
Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution (Save) check. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d4 poison damage and becomes temporarily infected with the chosen @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Disease}. On a successful save, it takes half damage and is not infected. An infected creature can repeat the save check at the end of each of its turns, ending the disease on a success.
    If the creature fails its Constitution (Save) check 5 times, they stop making the save, and the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Disease} remains indefinitely.

name: Banish
Mat-desc: an item that the target dislikes
descr:
Holding forth the components to ward the creature off, you attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Presence (Save) check or be banished, remaining in its new plane of existence until the spell ends.
    If the target is not native to this plane of existence, it returns to its home plane. If the spell does not end before 1 minute, the spell does not reverse when it ends, leaving the creature in its home plane.
    If the target is native to the plane that it is currently in, it is instead banished to a harmless pocket plane. While there, the target is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.3CQC3JEY2C3Y721F]{Incapacitated}, and remains there until the spell ends.
    When the spell ends, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

Charge: This spell can be Charged to target more creatures.

  • 2 Mana: 1 extra creature.
  • 4 Mana: 2 extra creatures.
  • 6 Mana: 3 extra creatures.
  • 11 Mana: 4 extra creatures.
  • 16 Mana: 5 extra creatures.

name: Battle Cloaking
Mat-desc: A pinch of diamond dust worth at least 100 gold, which the spell consumes
descr: You or a creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends, and anything the target is wearing and carrying is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.YE63H7VLOHW7NFHO]{Invisible} as long as it is on the target’s person.

name: Divinate
Mat-desc: 15gp worth of religion-appropriate offerings, which the spell consumes
descr:
By placing an offering and praying for a response, you become placed in contact with a deity or a deity’s servant. You ask a single question about a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The GM offers a truthful reply. The reply might be a short phrase, a cryptic rhyme, or an omen.
    However, the spell doesn’t take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion.
    If you cast this spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, your GM rolls a 1d4. Depending on how many times the spell has been cast, the chance of it failing goes up.
    The spell returns a random reading on a roll of 1 on the 2nd casting, 1 or 2 on the 3rd casting, 1-3 on the 4th casting, and automatically returns a random reading on the 5th+ casting.

name: Encapsulate
descr:
An iridescent sphere of magical force surrounds the creature or object that you choose of up to Large size or smaller, within range, that you can see. An unwilling creature may attempt a Dexterity (Save) check to avoid being enclosed. On a failure, the creature is encapsulated for the duration.
    Nothing at all, physical objects or attacks, energy, or other spell effects, can pass through this barrier. In or out. The creature inside can still breath, however. This sphere is completely immune to all damage, and as such the creature or object inside can’t be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside the bubble. With that in mind, the creature inside can’t damage anything outside of the sphere either.
    The magical sphere is weightless and forms just large enough to fit the object or creature inside it. A creature inside the sphere can spend an action to move itself and the bubble up to half its move speed. As well, the sphere can be picked up and moved.

name: Quicken
descr: Your heartbeat quickens and impatience floods your mind.  At the end of each of your turns, move up one space in the initiative order.

name: Remove Arms
descr: As an action, you target one weapon that a creature within 60ft of you is holding.  That creature must make a Presence (Save) check against your Spell Save DC.  On failure, the target’s weapon disappears into a pocket plane for the next 1 minute, reappearing at the target’s side at the end of this duration.  If the weapon is magical, the creature makes the (Save) check at advantage.

name: Shapeshift
descr:
Targeting a creature that you can see, that is within range, you cast this spell in an attempt to transform the target. An unwilling target may make a Wisdom (Save) check to resist the change.
    This transformation lasts for the duration of the spell, or until the target drops to 0 or dies. The new form assumed by the target can be any beast whose Challenge Rating is equal or lower than the target’s (though for those that don’t have Challenge Ratings, use level). The target’s game statistics, including all attributes except Intelligence, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. However, the target does keep its alignment and personality.
    The target assumes the hit points of this new form. When it reverts to its original form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it was transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, however, any excess damage carries over to its original form. As long as the excess damage doesn’t reduce the creature’s normal form to or below 0 hit points, it is not knocked unconscious.
    The creature is limited in the actions that it can perform by the nature of its new form: it can’t speak, cast spells, or take any action that requires hands or speech.The target’s gear melds into the new form and it cannot activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

name: Trapdoor Sinkhole
descr:
With a wave of your hand you create a hole with perfectly flat walls leaving only a thin cover over top. When stepped on the thin cover breaks and swallows up anyone stepping onto it.
    Upon casting, choose a spot to create the sinkhole; the dimensions are 5-foot-by-5-foot, and 30 feet deep. The spot chosen must be big enough to fully contain the sinkhole. Spotting the sinkhole to recognize it is there is a DC 20 Wisdom (Perception) check.
    If a creature travels across the space containing the sinkhole, or ends their turn on it, they must immediately make a Dexterity (Save) check. If the target fails, they fall into the sinkhole and take double falling damage for the distance fallen. Should the hole not be big enough to contain the creature walking over it, and they fail their save, instead their movement is immediately stopped for that turn and they must make a Strength (Athletics) check to move out of that space.
    The top of the sinkhole is a magical illusion and stays in place even after a creature has fallen inside it, meaning that other creatures still must make the Wisdom (Perception) check to know the sinkhole’s exact location. Additionally, a creature cannot see into the hole from outside of it, even if it knows where it is. However, a creature inside the hole can see out of it.
    At the end of the spells duration, or if it is ended abruptly, the sinkhole closes and forcefully ejects anything and anyone in it and throws it 5 feet in a random direction.

name: Winter’s Piercing Ray
descr:
Summoning forth the chill of winter, a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide of frozen energy blasts forth from you in a direction you choose. A creature caught in the line must make a Constitution (Save) check. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d6 cold damage and has its speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn. The damage is halved on a successful save, and their speed isn’t affected.
    Any space this line passes over is covered in snow and considered difficult terrain for the next 1 minute after casting.

name: Ashame
descr:
At a location within range, you create the shining, powerful, and intimidating image of your deity. Each creature within 40ft of this point that can see the image must make a Presence (Save) check. On failure, the creature takes 2d10 radiant damage.
    If the creature has stolen something, injured another creature, or had rolled a Presence (Deception) or Presence (Intimidation) check within the last 24 hours, the creature also takes an additional 2d10 radiant damage and becomes @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.UK95BQ45TGSD5Q3V]{Frightened} for the duration.
    On success in either situation, the creature takes half damage and is not frightened.

name: Greater Cure
Mat-desc: diamond dust worth 100gp, which the spell consumes
descr:
You imbue a creature with immense positive energy, reversing debilitating effects that most other spells cannot cure. This spell does one of the following effects to the target:

  • Reduce @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ERBR3AG01H4N1L91]{Exhaustion} by 1 level.
  • Remove one effect that @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.AKLQGCY7ULVB4B64]{Petrified} the target.
  • Remove one curse.
  • Unattune from one item, including attunement to a cursed item.
  • Revert any reduction to one of the target’s attributes.
  • Remove one effect reducing the target’s hit point maximum.
  • Changes one @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.JHOXE7HCCBCD8MSK]{Insane} creature from having Indefinite Insanity to Long-Term Insanity with the same symptoms.
  • Change one @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.JHOXE7HCCBCD8MSK]{Insane} Creature from having Long-Term Insanity to Short-Term Insanity with the same symptoms.
  • Cure one creature of Short-Term Insanity.
  • You cast @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-2.N04H7KQXVXSTATL9]{Lesser Cure} on the target.

name: Kinetic Burst
descr:
With a single motion you fling an enormous amount of mental power outwards in an attempt to throw others backward. Each creature within a 20 foot cube, originating from you, must make a Strength (Save) check. On a failed throw, the creature is hurled 30 feet away from you, is knocked prone, and takes 8d6 force damage. A successful (Save) check causes a creature to take half as much damage, they are not knocked @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}, and they are only moved 5 feet.
    In addition, any unsecured objects within range of the area of effect are automatically thrown 30 feet away.

name: Mind Shackle
descr:
With a wave of your hands you attempt to force a humanoid that you can see within range to submit to your authority. The humanoid must make a Wisdom (Save) check, and on a failure it is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} by you for the duration. Should you, or the creatures that are friendly to you, be fighting the target, it gets advantage on the (Save) check.
    While the target is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed}, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands and orders to the creature while you are conscious (no action required). The target will do its best to obey these orders. You can give simplistic or general course of action this way, such as ‘attack that person/creature’, ‘go into that corner’, or ‘grab that object’. If the creature completes an order and it doesn’t receive any further directions from you, it will defend and preserve its own life to the best of its ability, but nothing further.
    If you would like to give a more complex and precise order, you can take an action to exert more directed control over the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn’t do anything that you don’t allow it to do. During that time you can also have the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} creature use its reaction, at the cost of your own reaction.
    Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom (Save) check against the spell. Should it pass the save, then the effects of the spell end.

Charge: This spell can be Charged to have a longer duration

  • 2 mana: Concentration can be held for 1 hour
  • 4 mana: Concentration can be held for 8 hours

name: Noxious Wave
descr:
A cloud infused with the powers of death bursts out from you and causes those who breath it to begin to rot from the inside.
    A cloud of gas spreads out in a 30 foot radius around you. Each creature that you choose, that is hit by the cloud, must make a Constitution (Save) check. On a failed (Save) check, a creature takes 3d6 poison damage, as well as 3d6 necrotic damage, and is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9X088PM7H5U2S1HQ]{Sickened}. On a success the creature takes half damage and is not @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9X088PM7H5U2S1HQ]{Sickened}.
    The gas cloud stays active up to 1 minute if the caster concentrates to keep it going, but stays stationary. Creatures that pass through the cloud, or end their turn within it, must make a Constitution (Save) check. On a success, nothing happens and they pass through it without harm. On a failure, creatures suffer 2d6 poison damage and 1d6 necrotic damage. Additionally, should a creature that was @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9X088PM7H5U2S1HQ]{Sickened} fail a Constitution (Save) check against this effect, they become @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.SRRBLPRSJWGUR551]{Poisoned}.

name: Reincarnate
Mat-desc: a collection of rare minerals, metals, and water, altogether worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes
descr:
Touching at least a piece of a dead creature, you attempt to find the creature's soul to bring back to life in a new body.
    Provided that the creature has been dead for no longer than 10 days, the spell forms a new adult body from the material components and calls for the soul to enter that body. If the target's soul is free and willing to do so, the soul can enter into the body and take control of it, otherwise the spell fails and the body instantly decays.
    The body is fashioned from this spell by calling upon a deity, nature, spirits, or the world itself to help meld the body, and as such is unstable until the soul enters it, meaning that the body's final form is out of your control, likely causing the creature's race to change. The GM may choses a form that best suits the will of the force which you called upon when casting the spell, or may roll for the result. If so, the GM counts how many core races are available in this campaign and lines them up in alphabetical order on the following table and rolls a d100, rerolling if the result is empty.
    The DM may use a smaller die roll if the Total Available Core Races + 1 is smaller than 100.

    Once the core race is decided, fill in the above table with Branch Races that are compatible with the resulting Core Race and roll on that table.
    The reincarnated creature recalls its former life and experiences, retains its capabilities it had in its original form, but exchanges its original racial traits accordingly.

name: Telekinetic Might
descr:
You force your will upon your surroundings and can manipulate the physical world with your mental power. When you cast this spell, and as an action each round for the duration, you can exert your will on one creature or object that you can see within range, causing the effects described below for the appropriate target. You can affect the same target round after round, or choose a new one at any time during the duration. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.
    Creature: Using this spell you can try to move up to a Huge or smaller creature. To do so, make a skill check with your spellcasting ability contested by the creature’s Strength check. If you win the contest, you can move the creature up to 30 feet in any direction, including upwards, though you cannot move them further away from yourself than the range of the spell would allow. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is restrained in your telekinetic grip. If you lift the creature upwards, it is also suspended in mid-air.
    On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip by repeating the contest described above.
    Object: You can also attempt to move an object up to 1000 pounds. If the object is unattended (not being worn or carried) then you automatically move it up to 30 feet in any direction, but not beyond the reach of the spell.
    If the object is on someone’s person, or being carried or held, you must make a skill check using your spellcasting ability against the creature’s Strength check. If you succeed, you can move the object up to 30 feet in any direction so long as it does not go beyond the range of the spell.
    As well, you have fine control over objects in your telekinetic grip. Meaning you can do things such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door, stowing or retrieving an item, or pouring out the contents of a vial.

name: Telepathic Network
Mat-desc: a piece of thread with eight knots tied in it
descr:
You build a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range that you can see, forging a psychic bond between each creature to all the others for the duration. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 2 or less are not affected by this spell.
    The targets can communicate telepathically through the forged link whether they share a common language or not, for as long as the spell lasts. This communication is possible over any distance, however, it does not stretch across planes.

name: Unnatural Recovery
descr:
Pulsing magic through your systems, your natural healing abilities kick in faster and more notably than expected. The target may immediately spend 1 hit die to restore their hit points. At the start of each of their subsequent turns for the duration, they restore an additional 1d4 hit points.
    If the spell lasts its full duration, the target can regain the hit die it spent as part of this spell.

name: Concussive Force
descr: A ball of condensed air appears in your hand as you reel back your arm and throw it at a point within range that you can see.  Every creature within a 20 foot radius sphere originating from that point must make a Strength (Save) check.  On failure, they take 10d6 force damage, and are knocked @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}.  On success, they take half as much damage and are not knocked @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}.

name: Grave Ring
Mat-desc: powder from a crushed black gemstone worth at least 500 gp
descr: A ring of black flames appears and spins out into a 60 foot radius sphere from a point of your choosing that is within range that you can see.  All creatures caught in the area must make a Constitution (Save) check.  On a failed save the target takes 8d6 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful save.

name: Hundred Spear Assault
descr: At your call, a hundred ghostly spears are volleyed forward and fall in a line that is 100 feet long and 10 feet wide in a direction that you choose.  Creatures caught in the line must make a Dexterity (Save) check.  On failure, they take 7d6 piercing damage and 4d6 force damage, and have their speed reduced to 0 feet until the end of their next turn as the piercing spears hold targets in place.  On success, they take half damage and do not have their speed reduced.

name: Null Field
Mat-desc: an engraved crystal bead that shatters when the spell ends
descr:
A shimmering field appears as an immobile barrier that forms in a 10 foot radius centered around you and remains for the duration.
    Any spell that is of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier has no effect on creatures and objects within it, even if the spell is Charged to have a more powerful effect. Such spells can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell will have no effect on them. As well, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas of affect from spells of these levels.

Charge: This spell can be Charged to provide better protection:

  • 2 Mana: Spells of up to 6th level cannot penetrate the barrier.

name: Restore
descr:
A creature that you can see within range is overwhelmed by restorative energy. This creature regains 70 hit points, and is cured of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ADW4EH0NKRDCRCA4]{Blindness}, @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafness}, and any @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Disease} affecting it. This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

Charge: This spell can be charged to provide better protection:

name: Ruin
descr:
You magically unleash a vicious disease on the immune system of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution (Save) check. On failure, it takes 14d6 necrotic damage and contracts Ruin Disease. On success, the target takes half damage and is not @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9YPWLY1IHQV3MRLO]{Diseased}. The damage cannot reduce the target’s hit points below 1.

Ruin Disease: The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount as the damage dealt when contracted to a minimum of 1 hit point, and remains this way until cured or until 1 hour passes.

name: Sonic Shatter Spike
descr:
A large crystalline shard of aether materializes before you and rushes towards a target that you choose that you can see within range. Roll a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes 6d10 piercing damage. In either case the shard explodes, causing all creatures within 10 feet of the initial target to make a Dexterity (Save) check. On failure, that creature takes 4d6 piercing damage, or half as much on a success.
    At the beginning of your next turn all creatures injured or affected by this spell must make a Constitution (Save) check as the crystalline shards that hit them shatter in a sonic blast. On a failure, a target takes 5d6 force damage, but takes half as much damage on a success.
